meanings.definition: Induce (someone) to commit an unlawful act.
meanings.sent1: The criminal suborned his partner to rob the bank.
meanings.sent2: She was suborned into stealing the car by her friends.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat suborned the dog into digging up the garden.
meanings.sent4: The tempting aroma of freshly baked cookies suborned me into breaking my diet.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic music suborned the audience into dancing all night.

meanings.definition: Bribe or otherwise induce (someone) to commit perjury.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt lawyer suborned the witness to lie on the stand.
meanings.sent2: He was suborned by the wealthy businessman to provide false testimony.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student suborned his classmates into skipping school with promises of fun.
meanings.sent4: The politician's persuasive speech suborned the voters into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic rhythm of the music suborned the crowd into cheering for the band.
